oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Control of apple scab (Venturia inaequalis) in organic apple growing. StopScab: A Danish research programme for screening substitutes to copper fungicides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bengtsson, M.
Hockenhull, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Danish research project StopScab (2002-2004) has recently been initiated to identify and begin to develop some new approaches and materials for the control of apple scab in organic growing. Four linked objectives are included: 1) screening of materials for scab control 2) histopathological investigation of host-pathogen interactions 3) orchard testing of selected control compounds and 4) characterisation of metabolite profiles in apples
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Bengtsson, M. and Hockenhull, J. (2002) Control of apple scab (Venturia inaequalis) in organic apple growing. StopScab: A Danish research programme for screening substitutes to copper fungicides. Poster at: 6th International IOBC / wprs Workshop of Pome Fruit Diseases, Lindau, Germany, 31.8 -5.9 2002.
